title: By Adverse Winds. [A novel.]
author: Smeaton, William Henry Oliphant.
snippet: This was during Mrs. Langton's period of devotion to the State Church and the Moloch of Erastianism, as she stated in after-years. On this account the widow of the umquhil William Langton assumed "quite a mildly flirtatious air," and actually committed the astounding indiscretion to walk one Sunday afternoon as far as Old Pentland with Mr. Durden, to visit a miner's wife whom Providence had blessed with twins the day before!
